alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 5:28AM HST until November 30 at 8:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 815 AM HST. * At 528 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over southeast facing slopes of the Big Island, with the heaviest rain occurring in the coastal communities from Pahoa to Pahala. Rain was falling at a rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour. Emergency Management on the Big Island reported that Wood Valley Road near Pahala has been closed. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Volcano, Wood Valley, Glenwood, Pahala, Mountain View, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Hawaiian Acres, Naalehu, Orchidlands Estates, Keaau, Pahoa, Papaikou, Hawaiian Ocean View, Pepeekeo and Fern Forest. This warning may need to be extended beyond 815 AM HST if flooding persists. This Flash Flood Warning replaces the previously issued Flood Advisory that was in effect for The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry.
